review: Had a fantastic lunch here. The service was excellent, the manager stopped by to make sure everything was fine, and that veggie burger was sooooo incredibly tasty! Everything was on point, I was pleasantly surprised. Will be back to this location again!
Two words-Food Poisoning.  Really too bad because we enjoyed our past visits. Ordered whiskey river bbq burger. Husband violently ill a few hours later. Vomiting,chills and diarrhea. Disgusting.

Sorry Red Robin but you have lost us as customers after today's visit.  We stopped in BECAUSE you have rootbeer floats.  However hubby wanted ice cream instead of soft serve.  We were willing to pay more ur order rootbeer AND ice cream on the side.  However we were surprised when our waiter told us that over a month ago you all did away with your french vanilla ice cream.  In addition he went into comment that when someone does order ice cream they take the soft serve and toss it in the freezer to turn it up..... sorry but just cause it's hard that doesn't make it ice cream.  No where on your menu did it indicate anywhere you were doing this substitution on the deserts that advertised ice cream.  A label would have done the trick till it was time to do a menu reprint.   It's one thing to not have something in stock.... it's another to just substitute a different product from what is advertised.

Red Robin has become a "default" restaurant for me since moving to the 'burbs. I tried this location on 3/4/17 with my husband.  Although the menu and décor is similar to other Red Robin's, this location has one very distinct difference. It caters to children (and families). The waiting room has chalkboards for kids to play with and the servers seemed to be prepared and ready with the high chairs.  I had the salmon sandwich. It wasn't great and I don't plan on ordering it again. It was basically a piece of fish on a bun with little to no sauce. (If I go back I will go back to my "usually". I enjoy their veggie burgers with a fried egg.)  In a nutshell, this is a great option if you have a family that you'd like to take out for dinner.

It's been a long time since I've been here. We went because they were offering free tavern burger and bottomless fries for Veterans Day. My boyfriend had the burger and I ordered the wrap and soup combo. I got the chicken Caesar wrap and chicken tortilla soup. The wrap was ok... it was just chicken, Cesar dressing, lettuce, and tomato. I felt that it could've used a little more Cesar, but that's just me. The chicken tortilla soup was good, but the tortilla chips on top came out soggy so I'm wondering how long has it been sitting there or how bad are their tortillas? The soup was somewhat flavorful, but all in all it was just ok. I remember they had a ramen burger for their new special and that was terrible. I just don't think I like their burgers very much. They try to do too much and sometimes simple is the best.

I came here with the kids so a surprise dinner.  We had about a 5 minute wait.  We were sat at a table where my son could watch the basketball game and he was thrilled.  The kids could also see into the kitchen from our seats so they were guessing when our food was coming out. My daughter's meal came out incorrectly but the server quickly fixed it.  She ate her entire bowl of mac & cheese.  My son inhaled his meatballs and apple slices. My burger came out and it was perfect.  I used my app to count my calories and was able to eat half of my burger and 7 french fries and I had a meal for the next day's lunch (minus the fries because they are gross when reheated). Our drinks were kept full.  We paid our check at the table on the touchscreen computer.
The burger was average and the staff had okay customer service. I would opt to go to Five guys if I were in the mood for a burger.

While much of what I wrote before still stands, there has been a significant turnover in both serving staff and management. This is common in chain restaurants, though usually good hiring procedure results in a pretty standard quality of service. This has not been the case here, with service times increasing greatly and managers being more about explaining why things are going wrong rather than by finding solutions for those issues.  As a final thought, I would err on the side of clarifying your coupons before using them here. I was given a hard time about the last one I tried to use, despite it being seemingly eligible for the purchase I was making. Go figure. Check in advance!

If you advertise bottom less fries...give us "bottom less fries" !!! If I ask for more fries don't look at me like I'm stealing or taking advantage of your business please !!! Now, the burgers are awesome, service could be better, and wait time not bad...how about smiles?

After a previously bad experience with this particular restaurant I risked another chance with them and was disgustingly disappointed.  I picked up a salad to go yesterday and took it back to work. After eating nearly half the salad I pulled a very long blondish colored hair out of my mouth!  Ugggh  Was barely able to keep what I'd already eaten down.  No, I did NOT call or go back as they would have only offered me free food on future visits and trust me, there will not be any future visits to this place.  One bad experience is an accident, but two bad experiences is unacceptable.

It was sooooo bad! that I walked out. Floors and tables was not clean and greasy. Waited a long time before waiter came to table to take drink orders. His communication was bad and he was rude to my mom and niece. And we never got our food as we waited 20 min and continued to watch for a few more minutes as people who came in after us received their food. I had to get some one to flag down the manager to indicate the horrid service that occured and she (the manager) was not helpful after I gave her a layout of what should and should not occur with a customer.  l left as I am sure the waiter, whom seemed to not like our ethnicity or care, would of put something in our food.  I WILL NEVER come back to a Red Robin! They have turned for the worst which is sad because in Chicago they were really good but this one really SUCKED to the 5th power! I do NOT recommend!!

Driving down the street an eye catching "gourmet burgers and beers" sign grabs our attention..little did we know it was Red Robin, nicely played- you got us! We decided since we were already in the parking lot and would probably never decide to come again that we would give it a shot. Yeaaaaah, definitely a once in a blue moon type deal. We were greeted by a young lady at the host stand that looked like she'd seen better days- I think she was sick, you know that face that you can't hide when you feel so under the weather? Poor girl, I wanted to send her home myself. The atmosphere itself was just odd- it felt kind of sad in there, I'm not sure how else to describe it.  We were seated in the bar area at a high table and told our server would be right over...10 minutes passed and still nothing- we decided to move to the bar. One of my biggest pet peeves is when someone says "huh?" when they've misheard you- as an industry worker (as I myself have been) you never say "huh?" to your guests (or anyone..grr) so that put me off a little. That being said, our bartender was nice but the bar itself seemed to be lacking some essentials, such as half sized beer naps you get pretty much every other place you go- ours were the long napkins which she folded in half- not a big deal, just seemed odd. We spent a few minutes browsing the menu; sooo many things but nothing that jumped out. We got a half order of the onion rings, they were decent; we were half way through our half order when our food arrived..it wasn't timed right at all. We got the whiskey bbq river burger meduim (it was cooked medium well) and the California chicken club (I was craving quac). Neither were very impressive or too ehh; the burger however would have been much better had it been cooked to the temperature we ordered it. We were also charged extra for a dipping sauce we wanted to try with the onion rings, our bill came out to almost $40, not thrilled. Overall it was one of those experiences you look back on and think, I didn't miss anything by coming and I sure won't miss anything not coming back.

Our waiter,Eric? I think that was his name was great!  Very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu.  I got the red robin burger with the fried egg, medium well and it was superb.  The fries were hot and the wings he recommended for my friend mustve been great because he ate them all with the sauce on the side.  I'll definitely go back.
Love this place. Their freckled lemonade is the best with their whisky river bbq wrap! I only ever come here maybe 2-3 times a year though.

Red Robin is slowly upping their game - they are expanding their menu with more unique burger/smokehouse/brewpub options and have a greater craft beer selection to entice the patrons. Luckily they still have the unlimited fry refills and bottomless beverages. I'm a fan of the five alarm burger with jalapeno coins and chipotle aioli. Try the fries with honey poppy and ranch - always a hit.

I have not been here in a couple of years, as the kids picked this place for dinner, and I was pleasantly surprised. We walked in to a bustling atmosphere, and our party of three was seated right away.  Our waitress arrived shortly thereafter and took our drink order, explained the menu and offered suggestions on appetizers (I always like this as they have the inside scoop).   Our first dinner item was the Red's Tavern double burger with a side of fiery ghost pepper sauce and garlic herb fries.  The burger was juicy and had lots of flavor and the ghost pepper sauce was just the right amount of kick.  The garlic fries are addicting-ly yummy and I could have made a meal on that alone.  And, the fries are bottomless! The little one ordered the kids cluck-a-doodles and fries.  She, seemed to enjoy them. I ordered the Avo-Cobb-O, and Oh was it good!  The mixed greens were fresh and very crisp, hard-boiled eggs, bacon, bleu cheese, avocado and grilled chicken was delicious.  I thoroughly enjoyed my dinner selection. Our waitress was on point with accuracy, smiles and speed.  If you haven't been in a while, give it a try again as I was impressed for this type of restaurant, plus it's easy on your wallet.

Showed up before noon on a weekday with a group of eight from work and found the place already almost full. We didn't wait long though to be seated outdoors at two four tops pushed together. Strategy on my part avoided me having to sit at the crack between the tables. The host didn't have enough menus for everyone and promised to return with more (never did).  The first sign of lackluster service to appear.  Our server finally appeared to take our drink and app orders. He would disappear though for long periods of time perhaps because he also had some inside tables to serve? We ended up having an Executive style 90 minute lunch hour due to this slow service.  Fortunately the food (when it finally showed up) was hot, fresh and delicious. I tried something different this go around ordering their regular burger wrapped in lettuce in an effort to recover some calories I burned on a couple of their yummy onion rings as an app. Turned out to be delicious albeit a bit messy. I paired it with broccoli to go even more healthy. If my wife was with we would have split one of their awesome shakes.  I would give them three stars for the food but the service was so lame that I had to mark them down for that.
Great customer service, food is delicious and they have a good beer selection. I will definitely come back.

Food is hit or miss. But the reason to come is the kids menu-- healthy as well as decadent choices! We like the AYCE broccoli and mandarin orange options for kids. Very cool. Adults also have a wide variety of choices.
Love this place and the servers. Wayy better than the liberia location which has a manager with a attitude.

Usually pretty decent. Our waitress today, Brigette,  couldn't be bothered. Kept walking right past our table. She was also semi rude to my kids. Another one of the staff felt bad and came over twice to take our app and drink orders. No excuse for that level of poor performance.

Not worth it, go to Five Guys across the way Ordered a patty melt and chili fries to go. When asked what kind of cheese, I asked to make sure "its 2 slices right" response was yes, of course. I asked for cheddar....yeah only came with 1 slice... after calling to complain the manager (Nice guy, gave me a full refund) said that only American comes with two slices...HOW CAN YOU MAKE A PATTY MELT WITH 1 SLICE OF CHEESE? On top of that, they forgot to put the 1000 island dressing on it.... also asked for medium and got well done. Fries were all room temp( I was there to pick up before it was ready and my work is like a 3 minute drive) chili room temp. Sad Bartender who took my order was not very friendly and acted kinda hostile (short Mexican girl with a boys short short hair style, word tattoo on her forearm) and did not put any napkins, silverware nothing in the bag...hard to eat chili cheese fries without a fork... all this after giving more than a 20% tip on a to go order.

I like the quality of service. Their chef makes sure that you get the quality you want. His name is Walter. I am a picky person and I specifically asked to make sure about the ingredients of what I ordered. He stepped out of the kitchen and answered all my questions. The food was in excellent quality. I understand that the quality of service is the collective efforts of all people working in a restaurant. But I believe that the quality of food is the main criteria people will comment on. So a big five start for the responsible awesome chef!

This is one of those - if I could go lower than 1 star - I would. I wrote the review during the boring an frustrating wait, while the vast amount of staff avoided my looking around for assistance. You know, the fixed looking ahead and avoiding eye contact with the person trying to get somebodies attention. Even though it's early afternoon and the place isn't really that packed. Anyway When I get to pay, it's a novel little card swipe screen device one on each table. Mine wasn't working, and the server who eventually returned to my table brought me another one. I swiped my card, and the display showed what I had ordered. Then it gave me the option of adding a tip. A sliding scale on a touch screen. Ahhh the American tipping protocol, well I'm not American and I don't have a problem in lowering the tip if the service has been wanting. So, I move the slide to 15%. The machine throws up an ERROR screen. I start over, and it does it AGAIN, one more time and ERROR. So, I try once more leaving it the 20% mark that it suggests. SURPRISE it works. THIS IS A CON TO MAKE YOU TIP AT A RATE YOU DO NOT WISH TO.  I, for one will never go to a Red Robin again.

My 2 year old son has multiple severe food allergies and red robin has become our special restaurant.  We've been to a ton of red robins but today at the Chantilly location really stuck out in my mind.  Our waitress was amazing. She even took the time to chat about his allergies and I noticed when she gave him his fries she doubled checked to make sure there was no seasoning.  In today's society, it's hard to find people that care and are compassionate.  Most people don't get it,  but she did. Our experience was just wonderful at this location.

Okay, food is good! Employees are nice. Service is good once one gets inside their building. BUT, try calling in an order to pick up and YOU WILL WAIT ON HOLD FOR A WHILE! They do not value call in orders.For the last four times ordering over the phone hoping to pick up dinner and transferred a time of two, I have been told, "Can I put you on hold FOR A FEW MINUTES?" And they don't mean 5 minutes! Last time I called, and was placed on hold, I finally got through and asked to talk to a manager...Katie. I was told the reason one gets put on hold is because there are only three telephone lines into the business. Red Robin  Management needs to fix this.
Out standing experience overall.  The server needed a little help, but ok.  I like the tablet at the table to order, and pay from.  Expedites the process for sure.   Very good overall!

We've been to this location several times, but each time we go, we tell ourselves, we won't be back. Red Robin has re-marketed themselves. Gone are the baskets with the hamburgers wrapped have way (which we loved). They now are served on plates, but are messing and not enjoyable to eat. My family of four always gets the Royal Red Robin. When they were wrapped up, they were so easy to eat. Now they arrived on a plate, with a small cup of fries. They are messing to eat. A side note on our last visit, they couldn't serve any draft beer. Apparently they ran out of CO2 or something that was required to serve beer. That was a bummer. Odd.  They are losing us as customers at this point.

Went in at 4 o'clock on Saturday the hostess Brenda had 11 people in line when we were seated we were third in line there were 26 empty tables.In between seating each group of people she would walk around the restaurant and talk to people then go back and seat people.    Natalie was our waitress. They brought out our burgers before they brought out our appetizer. Our burgers were not made the way we asked for them. I feel this place is becoming more of a bar than a restaurant.    I used to enjoy bringing my kids here now I feel it is more of a bar atmosphere. The servers basically give you exactly what is on the menu and if you asked to add or subtract an item from a burger good luck.    Since I really like their food I think I will try  there Fair Lakes location. If this were the first second or third time they made a mistake I would think it was no big deal but it seems to be a constant problem.
The DGB burger is great. Roasted tomatoes, savory roasted garlic aioli and fresh arugula tossed in citrus olive oil dressing on a toasted ciabatta bun.  Price $12.99

We like Red Robin.  It's a solid burger most of the time.....bottomless fries (not that you need to be eating all those fries) and they will bring some out as an appetizer if you ordered a burger!  No need to order an appetizer if you are starving!   Variety of burgers is huge.....veggie and turkey burger are really good there if you are interested in that.   They only cook burgers through so you can't get medium rare - which I like - but I can live with that.  They are still juicy and tasty.   Salads are pretty good there too as well as the chili but if I am going there I ususally stick with a burger.  They have a thing with all these sauces you can choose from - not sure I am a real fan of those.  I  stick to what comes on the burger and sometimes we ask for ranch and/or honey mustard for the fries. I am also a fan of the Red Robin seasoning they have on the tables.  Sprinkle some on the fries - yum!  If you really like it - ask to buy some......it's great on steak and burgers at home - chicken too! Wait staff can be on and off.  Doesn't usually have a huge impact on our overall experience though.   Join the Red Robin Royalty Club!  You don't need the card - register your phone number. Free burgers !

Food takes forever Drinks have NO alcohol (literally)  The server told us they put an ounce of alcohol in their drinks and we would have to order a double to be able to taste it, yet half their tag line has alcohol in the name. Slow service -- like forever for anything. Used to be a great place, moved fast. Ever since they changed the layout to forcing adults to sit in the bar section, the place is a mess. Hugely disappointing.

Came here on a Sunday night for my daughter's birthday.  I can understand a 45 minute wait but not when an entire section of tables is closed.  I counted more than a dozen, many of them not bused.  I can only assume they don't have enough staff which doesn't make much sense on a non-holiday weekend.  This is not the first time we've observed this issue.  We've been coming here for more than 8 years and the food is usually consistent.  Quality of service varies, especially on short staffed nights but you can't much blame the wait staff.
One of our favorite spots! Sit in the bar for the best service and great beer specials all day. We can't get enough bottomless fries with campfire ranch!

Fortunately I've been to Red Robin before, otherwise this would have been my 1st and last time. Our waiter acted like he would have rather been anywhere else but there. It was empty, but our waiter forgot he was supposed to actually wait on us. Margaritas never showed up. Requested water with lemon, but did not receive and was annoyed when requested on the refill he tried to ignore. Seemed inconvenienced to take our food order. Asked if we needed anything else once our food came while drink cups sat empty. All in all a very disappointing experience.

To start, there was no one at the front when I walked in. I actually had to walk around a bit to find someone. I placed a to go order which took 20 mins to come out. I found this kind of weird because I had a small order and there were hardly any other customers in the restaurant. When I got my food it was lukewarm at best. I definitely won't be going back here.
Burgers were very good as were the French fries. We were seated very quickly. But waited quite a while to get our food delivered after ordering. Very busy place pretty clean
Always good eats at Red Robin. I tried the Fish and Chips and it did not disappoint. Crispy and moist cod and the chips were excellent too.

We arrived for dinner with no wait at all. The place was pretty empty considering for a Sunday evening. Ordered nothing fancy... Burgers.. The rating on the food was average. Your typical burger. Service was actually very slow. Im not sure why they have a buzzer to call your server when ours took foooorever to even acknowledge that we needed anything. She was obviously too busy to talking

Have always liked red robin but it is slowly turning from a place for great burgers to one where the bottom line is more important then customer service. 1) order a second drink immediately when u r served the first b/c u won't see ur server again. 2) even though they say endless fries, what they really mean is an endless wait until u actually get more. The 12 fries that u get are great for the baby, but suck for u b/c u will never get anymore... 3) lastly don't sit outside - as this is where it all is currently happening....now we want to pay - hope u don't see our skeletons when u come in!!!

I am not a fan of the Red Robin in Manassas - check out that review for details... however, my girlfriends wanted to meet at the Chantilly location for lunch yesterday so I bit my tongue and went for it. The parking lot was packed; it was lunch time, so I knew the inside was bound to be a mad house.  They were packed, like... we got the last table packed. The server was prompt and had our drinks for us immediately.  We had an 18 month old with us and she quickly had the children's menu there so we could get his lunch ordered first. The service was good.  Order was taken correctly and our drinks stayed full.  That is leaps and bounds above Manassas already. I ordered the Bonzi Burger.  It was yummy and done exactly the way I wanted. Pro's... they stopped wrapping the burgers in that white paper.  I was never a fan of that.   It served no purpose and just got in the way.  Glad my food just comes on a plate now instead of a "to go" wrapper in a plastic basket. Con's... not really a con, just annoying... the fries, they are amazing!  And they give you like eight of them with your burger.  I know they are bottomless, but I don't want to have to sit and wait 12 minutes for more.  Put some damn fries on the plate! I want my food at one time, and eight fries next to my burger is just a tease. I'll be back to this location.  They are much more efficient and the food just over all tastes better.  I was honestly waiting for a soggy blah gray burger like I had in Manassas, but Chantilly does it spot on!!
Half an hour wait for food alongside a rude waiter..nah....I rather eat at home...no thank you sir!
I love this place had all of my birthdays here and was never  disappointed the fries are well made the burgers are to die for but the service is ehh would give 5 if they improved with that

okay so im out with my friends and I ask so where does everyone wanna eat at? and they all chirp RR! As if my life couldnt get any worse. Of all the eateries out there including the dreaded Olive Garden or Red Lobster ( dirty rachet lobster) they insisted on this place. Usually I have bad memories of RR, no matter where I go, so here I was expecting worse. Much to my surprise, the employees were all sane, happy and actually working and not waiting for their Iphones to flash. So we get seated, they we get our waiter, who was nice, gets our drinks fast. We ordered wings and chips...by all means, just get wings by itself do not eat those nasty $1.00 walmart type chips... We get our wings, nice and crispy but who in their right mind heats up chips and drowns them in buffalo sauce? where they do that at? tell me honey!! Okay, so the appetizers were a little on the womp womp side. but the burgers were good. not great, as I notice that the burger patties are shrinking. they use to slice your burger in half, just so you can see the middle, now it seems they dont so they can hide their tracks, i guess. the burgers are okay. A little stingy on fries but its bottomless and here they will refill and not play games or make you wait unlike in MOCO were ...um... well just go back and read my old reviews of RR. I give this place 4 stars for the food, 5 stars for our waiter, he was on point. refills without being asked, napkins, hauling our dirty dishes as we eat, just on point with everything. we had an issue with our bill and the lovely manager was on point, and handled it every well, she was very apologetic and sincere. overrall, this was a painless experience minus the buffalo chips.
Worst service ever! Burger wasn't cooked to what I asked and there was no bottomless fries. Asked for more but they didn't bring it so I just paid and left. Never coming back here ever again!

As I sit here in the restaurant to write my review...I have yet to have anyone come over to ask me if I want the check.  Dirty bathrooms (tissues and uri e everywhere), inconsistent service (server brings 3 forks and 3 napkins - we're a party of 5), utensils are dirty and spotty.  Cups come out to the table wet. Had to beg for a refill...yet servers everywhere on phones and doing non-important things instead of tending to customers.  All boils down to management.  Food is okay...
Food was good.  Not accurate to what we ordered, and it took a long time to get to us, but pretty tasty nonetheless

Terrible Service can ruin everything! Let me follow be saying; I am a fan of Red Robin.  I love their food, the feel of their establishments and the overall experience of going.  I've been to several RRs in my area and never had a complaint that warranted a negative review or a complaint period.  Until I visited this particular location. I was headed to Chantilly with my mother to visit a friend and remembered passing by this location several times in the past.  So last night was the perfect time to grab a bite to eat.  The parking area is fairly small for the number of guests it can seat inside. But nothing to lose my head over.  When we entered, it didn't appear to be as busy as the parking lot suggested, we were greeted immediately by a very courteous host and seated by the bar.   Red flag one:  We were seated at a four person table; when we clearly saw two-seaters available.  But again, I just assumed that no servers were working that section; so I let it go. Red Flag two: Our waitress, who finally arrived 10 minutes later was also the bartender.  Which means she was filling orders for the bar, making the drinks and taking orders from the bar as well as the main dining area and the outside patio adjacent to the bar. Meanwhile there were other servers in that area, that could have been more attentive. We ordered our drinks (Freckled Lemonade and a Milk Shake).  Red Flag three:  The lemonade is $3.99 w/ free refills. Not once throughout the evening did the waitress ask if a refill was needed and the Shake was 3/4 filled with the rest of the glass filled with whipped cream.  (On an unsanitary note: One guy working the bar; probably a manager of some type by what he was wearing; after filling a drink order used his fingers to clean the inside of a glass that he just filled with beer). Once we finally got our orders in, it was the kitchen's turn. Red flag four: After more than 20 minutes of waiting for two burgers; one of which that was cooked medium, the food finally arrived.  However, this was still after two other tables (table of 2 and 3); that were sat and ordered after us; received their food.  I guess the wait staff was also responsible for bringing out the food for the tables they were helping; which is unorthodox considering all that she was doing and the other staff there.    The food thankfully was cooked wonderfully.  The only small issue was one of the burgers was missing bacon, but that was quickly corrected.  The main reason to go to RR did not disappoint. Excellent burgers (Guacamole Bacon and Bacon Cheese). Following the meal, the server came and got our plates off the table; which was the fastest thing she did the whole time.  Next came another 20 minute wait for the check in which time our server completely disappeared from sight. We did not see her for the rest of the night. We had to grab another server in order to get the check at which time we asked to speak to a manager.  The waiter tried to smooth things over by removing our drinks, but it was far too late for that. Afterwards we were greeted by a "Manager in Training" who took off 50% for the inconvenience. Needless to say this is one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had; which is so hard to say for an establishment that I've never had to complain about until now.  This will not deter my RR visits in the future, only to this particular location and its horrible service!

It may be a bit hard to categorize Red Robin. Is it a "better burger" chain like BGR or Five Guys? Or is it best thought of as a casual sit down place like Friday's or Ruby Tuesday? Either way, the chain as a whole and this location in particular are good, generous, and well prepared...service is friendly and competent if not always as speedy as it could be. (I suspect actually, that there's a trade off here, a reasonably low priced menu won't generate many tips unless each server has an above average number of tables.) The tavern burgers, Royal Red Robin Burger, and Milkshakes ar all great. The unlimited refills on many sides (salad, fries etc) are great of you are hungry. Deserts are much better than one would expect from a chain restaurant. All-in-all a good place.

The manager at this location is THE BEST. Her name is Katie (short for Kathryn). She went above and beyond what was expected when i had a question about my bill after we dined with a big group there after a lacrosse game. Red Robin should be so proud of Katie and the way she is running this establishment. Food is awesome too!
Freckled lemonade, Buffalo wings and onion rings with the tavern burger that's the way to go!!!  Love this place!!

This place was perfect for "date night" with my 5 y.o. daughter (she loves burgers). She bought a kids cheese burger and a shake. I had the Royal. The Kid's menu was fun and there was one of those new video menus with games on it (you have to pay for it.). It was a Saturday night but the wait was tolerable. The wait staff was terrific. I've been at Red Robin's all over the country and their food is always good and consistent.

The food was absolutely terrible the waiter was not attentive. This is the 3rd time I've gone there and they have undercooked my hamburger. Then they charged us for playing a game we never played. And proceded to ignore me when I tried to ask for the manager I strongly encourage others to go elsewhere for their lunch and dinner. Red robin has proven they are not loyal to their customers.

Very disappointing, even for this chain. The burger was flavorless. The fries were great but other sides were not good. Kids meals were fine. Service was slow and not really great in any way. Just unfortunate. Other locations have proven better. Will never return to this one.

I typically love RR and I've eaten here at this location literally 50 or more times. However the past five or six visits have been very poor service. Just an overall lack of attention to detail. Mixed bag as to the good ones. Food still very good though. They need to get their mojo back on the service side.

I think they need a serious overhaul of management at this location.  I tried to eat here with a group of coworkers (30 people maybe) and we had one server.  A lot of us had preordered before hand and it took over an hour to get our food.  My friends and I complained but that seemed to make the wait even more. I later heard there were a number of parties but that didn't make me feel any better.  When I finally got my burger it was made wrong.  I won't be back anytime soon.  Why have only one server for over 30 people?  Finally I think the people who didn't preorder got their food faster.  They should change the name of this place to Dead Robin.
25 minute wait to have the wait staff spill beer on my daughter.  No manager in sight.  Not sure if the bame is with the bar staff or waitress

This place is a chain similar to Chili's or Applebees.  It's nothing fancy but if you're dying of hunger this place will save you.  I normally don't eat at chain restaurants like these (except Red Lobster which is AWESOME) because there are so many places to try specially when you're in a new city.  But that day I was not feeling adventurous (due to a hangover) and it was just down the street from the hotel so it was convenient.  They have a full bar so they do serve liquor which is just what you need when hungover.  They make a great Cadillac Margarita (Patron and Grand Marnier).  I got one of their signature burger and steak fries which was delicious.  Huge portions and at a reasonable price. The highlight of this place is our waiter, James.  He provided such exceptional service and was very friendly & polite.  He was also very helpful with the area and even gave us detailed directions to a few places we wanted to go to.  I think if he was going on break he literally would've drove us.  That's how above and beyond this kid went.  Big ups to James, the margarita and that Guacamole Burger with Bacon!

Red Robin has a fun atmosphere and service is pretty good but the quality of the food needs to be improved.  I recently tried their guacamole burger with bacon.  The burger was standard and tasty but the guacamole was pretty much absent just a slight tinge of green on the bun!  The tomato was the standard slice of flavorless Florida beef steak and the bacon was rubbery and looked more like it had been boiled than fried up.  For the cost, over 10 dollars, the quality is lacking.

A bit pricey, but it is great food. I always get the Royal Red Robin, which has a fried egg on it. Hamburge places are always tricky for me, because I really still find that the best burgers I eat are at my house, so to compete with that is very difficult.  I'd prefer to not pay $10 for a burger, which also normally makes it hard for me to give great ratings to a burger place.   All in all, though, I like Red Robin.  Their steak fries are pretty good -- normally the Royal comes with unlimited fries, but I am normally full after eating the burger and the first basket of fries.   They also have some pretty good appetizers ... but, again, the miser in me comes out when it comes to the appetizers: if I get unlimited fries, why would I spend extra money on an appetizer?  So, normally, I only order an appetizer if the whole family goes and it looks like it'll be a long wait.

We were sucked in by the new sign....Gormet Burgers and Brew.  We stopped in looking forward to a good beer and a good burger but its just Red Robin with a fancy new sign.  The waitress was very lovely the service was excellent the beer selection was less than you would find at a normal restaurant and the burgers were the same just look fancier on the pretty menu.

Well helllooo endless fries =). This is my first time at Red Robin and I have to say it was pretty good. The servings are big and because of the endless fries, I don't think you will leave hungry. What I like about this place is the full blown kids menu where my niece and nephew had choices of their entree and their side and their drink which was nice. It's a pretty typical menu for adults. I chose to go with chicken salad caprese... which was actually pretty good. It's basically salad with grilled chicken and some type of vinegrette dressing and then 3-4 huge slices of mozzarella. Yum! Not bat at all. Did i mention the endless fries? Because although the fries weren't the best thing I've tasted, they were decent enough for us to refill like 3 to 4 times. And they have the seasoning old bay type of seasoning on the table so you can have the fries as salty or as bland as you want. Why only 3 stars? Well part of any great restaurant are the servers and unfortunately our server wasn't so nice. I know it's tough work to get orders from kids, but buck up and put on that fake smile if you have to. And it's not like the kids were being too difficult, they just got a little stuck on trying to see what side they wanted and already the dude is rolling his eyes. Whoa whoa whoa... maybe he had a tough day though so I can't really complain too much, but I've worked in the restaurant business before and if you want that tip, you at least gotta smile and hold the rolling of the eyes thank you! In any case, food was fine, endless fries great, service.. not so much. Maybe it'll be better the next time around.

Don't try to get a quick lunch at the bar! This location thinks one bartender can do it all. While she was nice, they expect her to serve a 10+ seat bar, AND make drinks/milkshakes/etc. for servers, AND answer the phone, AND take to-go orders, AND serve several tables in the bar area.  After waiting a solid 5 minutes to even see what the bartender looked like, order a drink and my food, I waited another solid 30 minutes for the chicken sandwich to be delivered from the kitchen. When I finished eating, I scooted my plate (complete with silverware and napkin on top) to the edge of the bar to indicate I was finished, and after another solid 5, she disappeared not to be seen again for 10 minutes! I was standing, with my coat on and credit card in hand, trying to pay and get back to work in a reasonable amount of time when she reappeared and began inputting orders into the computer, answering the phone, assisting a to-go customer, all before graciously letting me PAY for my lunch so I could leave! One star given (aside from the fact there is no option for 0 stars) because they really do have a good selection of reasonably priced lunch fare.

Last night found us in the Chantilly area around 8:30 p.m. & hungry for something good, yet quick.  "Red Robin" loomed up, & since neither of us had ever been to this chain before, decided to give it a try.  It was 8:30 p.m. on a Tuesday night, so guess not too surprising that except for one other table, we were the only patrons.  Husband just ordered water; I an iced tea ($2.59 with free refills) - both of which were brought promptly. Hubby ordered the "Turkey Burger" ($8.99 + $.99 for American Cheese).  While I'd like to quibble over the extra $.99 charge for a slice or two of American Cheese, hubby's burger was a nice thick obviously hand-formed burger, perfectly cooked.  I ordered the "Patty Melt", which was wonderful.  Perfectly cooked to "medium" burger & perfectly formed to fit on the wonderful fresh thick lightly-toasted Marble-Rye bread slices.  Burger was sandwiched between 2 slices of American Cheese & topped with a layer of perfectly sautéed sweet onions.  House-made Thousand Island Dressing was served in a decent-sized container on the side to add as one wished. Both of our orders came with their "Endless Fries", but frankly I'd be surprised if anyone outside of maybe children bother to ask for 2nds.  Fries are of the thick-cut "steak fry" variety, & in this case - as in 9 times out of 10 other places that serve this type - were hot enough temp-wise, but weren't crisp at all.  Floppy/soggy.  No wonder they offer them "endlessly" - probably can't get rid of them any other way - lol!   Of course, I'm a hardcore "shoestring" potato fry fan, so perhaps it's just personal preference rearing its ugly head.  But then, soggy is soggy. Service was excellent - prompt, friendly without being intrusive - exactly what restaurant service should be.  Bill after tax but before tip (which was generous) came to $22.64.  A definite bargain for the quality of the food. Bottom line - nice place for a casual well-prepared burger or sandwich (they offer veggie burger/sandwich options as well).  We'll definitely add this chain to our list of places worth visiting.

Just stopped in for happy hour with coworkers.  The bar area is a bit small and quickly got LOUD.  But hey - that's happy hour, right?  As usual they had a nice selection of cocktails, wines, and beers.  And the burgers?  Always a treat.  I had the royal Robin and it was fantastic.  The waitress was great and a good time was had by all.
Semi-decent food. Wish more attention to detail would be given to the overall cleanliness of the restaurant.

Wait staff needs more training. Beer was flat. Server was very slow on a pretty slow Saturday at 330pm. Food was average. After getting a second beer that was flat, I just got a coke which they absolutely charged us for. Weak experience.

Went with the in-laws over the weekend for an early lunch.  Service was pretty good and the food was tasty.  The burgers they offer are creative and fun.  This is one place i never order the same thing, On this trip I ordered off the insert and had them add bacon and bacon aioli.  I think it was their tavern style burger and the bacon option was something like "pig out" or "hog it up". We weren't ever given the opportunity to refill our fries
It's a good place to take your kids if you need to have a beer. And if you have kids like mine, you need to have a beer.

We went to this during lunch hours around 2 o clock in the afternoon.  The place was a little busy but we were seated quickly in the bar area for adults only.  Our server was very attentive and made sure we understood the specials and drink menu. We both ordered the tavern double after a minute of looking over the menu. As for drinks I ordered a bud light and my brother ordered a blue moon and the beers came to the table so fast even our server was surprised.  He was also kind enough to bring us a basket of fries to start working on.  Our food came out in less than 10 minutes and it was fantastic.  The tavern double is the classic double cheeseburger that everyone should have in mind.  The beef patties were small but they were extremely juicy and had a delicious flame broiled taste to them. The melty cheese really tops off the juicy flame broiled burgers and the burger had a seasoned aoili on it that really brought the burger together.  Overall it was a great experience and the tavern double is an excellent take on the classic american double cheeseburger.

hmmmm, I'm usually a good customer of Red Robin and I usually visit my local in Raleigh, North Carolina at least a couple of times a month with my wife, but  unfortunately this one was nothing more than a glorified mcdonalds and felt very "fast food". The  menu was varied with lots to choose from and the sandwiches we're great as usual, but the server was way too quick to take our order and burger came before we'd had time to finish our starter and the whole place just felt too rushed. we we're in and out in less than 40 minutes. sorry, but I won't be visiting this one again.

No draft Guinness! This place used to be great for Guinness and burgers - and now it comes in a can. That's a two stars deducted from what was a pretty good place. Now you're do better to go around the corner to the backyard grill.
Food was great.  Didn't have to wait long for the food but out drinks took forever.  Order your drinks ahead of time if you plan to drink here.

For a chain restaurant, this location seriously impressed me.  Perhaps we knew what we wanted to eat and drink right away, which helped expedite the order... but everything came out within 10 minutes of us being seated, no lie. Mushroom burger - medium well, a coke, sprinkle salt, pepper and ketchup... let's goooo! Service was phenomenal here.. extremely fast, friendly, and attentive. Our server (darnit, I forgot his name) was awesome. We never had to ask for a refill. He would seriously ninja up on us and slide a drink on the table as we were eating. Even when we got the check, this dude was still serving us! He continued to refill our drinks. Now, that's what I call service.

No, it's not a four star restaurant, but it is a great restaurant for the prices. I usually order the tavern burger. For $7 it's good, plus they'll bring you out some fries for free as an appetizer. The waitstaff is very competent.

This is a fun place.  I like the TV in the floor at the entrance. The burgers and fries are good here.  The endless fries are a nice touch.  The salads are just okay. Portions are generous. Overall, this is a decent place for a chain.
Love their burgers!  The sweet potato fries are amazing!  They also have very tasty milkshakes!

Red Robin has never been a favorite of mine: burgers are boring and American cuisine is pretty bland and fried anyway, but at least the restaurant has a bar.  This recent visit was terrible enough for me to write about...service was mediocre (neither server removed dirty plates from our table, drinks were not refilled unless we asked), our mixed drinks were diluted, boneless wings were drenched in Bonzai sauce, which had a weird, almost bitter taste, and my salad was drowned in dressing.  All around a poopy experience.  I hope I'm never dragged to another RR again.

Love Red Robin and the food, this location is usually the one my wife and I head to every friday night.  Great staff and love the food.  A little perplexed at how a "tall" Guiness looked like a pint.  Overall, highly recommended.  Only issue is parking, the building is next to another restaurant and a hotel so parking is kind of hard to find.
The new menu is terrible. I don't want to read a novel to decide what I want. On top of that, there isn't much more on the menu to warrant multiple pages from their front and back single page menu.

Service was great and food was your typical Red Robin's deliciousness, but it's empty, so I'd love to know why none of the surrounding tables are being bussed?? There were three when we walked in that are still dirty and another just opened up. Floors are also disgusting and the flat divider between booths is caked in dust. Doesn't this place have a manager??

My girlfriend kept insisting that I try the burger with the fried egg on top...really good!  French fries are to thick, but the onion rings are greeeat! Manager is very nice and staff are very professional, knowledgeable and attentive. Restrooms are a little small, but the dining room is spacious. They don't have Shinerbock, however they do serve Blue Moon.

I have been to this location a bunch and never had a bad experience.  I went there this time with a large group about an hour and a half before closing time.  The staff was very helpful and asked us repeatedly if we needed anything which was great because some of the places the waitress only comes back once or twice throughout the meals.  The food was excellent and cooked exactly the way I asked for it.

Ate around 1:30 PM on a Sunday.  Not every crowded but immediately the waitress seemed overwhelmed and irritated.  Eventually took our order, food came, then she was never to be seen again.  The order was wrong and I needed some water... since there are no other options i pushed the "Call Server" button on the silly TVs they have at the tables.  She eventually came over (by this point we were done.. I just ate whatever they brought) and said "Why is this red light flashing??", obviously irritated as if my son was being a pain.  I said I pushed it because you never returned and I wanted water... from there her attitude came out... acted irritated that I called her out for being rude.  We all have bad days, i get it, but that's what separates those who should and should not work in service industries.. putting on a smile.  Adding insult to injury, the bathrooms were a mess and no paper towels.  I imagine a corporate restaurant's quality control would not have been impressed.  Won't be back.

My family took me to Red Robin for Mothers Day, 2015 and I was very happy as I love Red Robin. But, it made it even better when we had great Service from a server, Ryan L. He was so nice and made me feel special. Ryan L. is the BEST

This chain is trying. But I just don't get the publics' fascination with this place. It's just a freaking burger joint! I have had them a couple of times. This one is really no different. I end up getting their 'Burning Love' burger every time and I do enjoy it. It's just when the check come around, their prices are not in line with the quality of their food. I feel jiped. (I.e. the Hooters effect.) Every time I'm roped into going to Red Robin I'm reminded why I prefer 5 Guys for lunch. (peanuts) Pro: Everyone wants to have lunch here so it's easy to get a ride. Con: Dude, their rippen' me off!
Good burgers; kids like the atmosphere...

We went on a weeknight, it was quite and plenty of servers were free (and sitting around, twiddling thumbs). My drink went empty for the majority of my meal, and with no intention of a refill. And how dare you ask for a refill on fries!

Was craving a cheeseburger and made the mistake of trusting my bf on a "good burger place". This place was very mediocre and they refused to cook my burger any less than medium. Do they do this to protect themselves because they don't use good quality beef? I can't see any other reason why a restaurant would refuse to cook meat medium rare. The burgers are pretty thin so it came out more like medium well. I was really disappointed and next time I will go to Clyde's and order my beloved medium rare bleu cheese burger.

I love all Red Robins and this location delivers very good food. My server however was a little slower than normal. Like she brought only one water refill when my husband had also needed a water refill. I do like the fact you can order boca burger to replace the meat and also can go "bun less". For me it is great since I like to save my calories for their bottomless fries. Delicious. BTW, I would recommend their mint brownie season shake. My husband ordered this shake yesterday and it was delicious! Also sign up for their eClub and you can get a free burger meal for your birthday. It is well worth it plus you get promos throughout the year

Warning: I'm cranky. The last few times I had been to this location, it hadn't been spectacular, but this time was a nightmare. And I really hate writing bad reviews.  We got there around 8:00. The place was probably less than a quarter full. Our server was reeeeally nice, but  didn't really know the menu.  We ordered the pretzel bites appetizer, which tasted more like salted donuts than pretzels. They were edible, but the beer cheese sauce that came with them tasted like they had mixed some Budweiser with some Velveeta.  As for the entrees...for some reason there was a long delay (20 minutes?)  between when we finished the pretzel bites and when the entrees came out, even though we ordered them at the same time. No big deal. There was a mistake with one of the entrees, and after waiting a while for our server to come back, I finally had to get up and find her to ask her to fix it. The cole slaw that came with the Clucks and Shrimp looked yellow and...goopy.  No one touched it.  The toddler in our party ordered pizza, which came with a little cup of mandarin oranges (with seeds?) on the side. The pizza looked greasy and soggy and sat at an angle in one of those red baskets so that all of the greasy cheese was slumped over to one side. The child took one bite, frowned and declared that it was "not good". Then he took a second bite and bit down on something hard. And that was the end of that. His hands went in to his mouth, trying to dig it out, and his face wrinkled up in a half-gag, and for a very tense minute I thought he was going to throw up. Thankfully, he did not. But he also didn't touch that pizza again. (Can't blame him.) My Bleu Ribbon burger was overcooked and was the weirdest combination of flavors I've ever had on a burger. There are few foods I won't eat if you put them in front of me, and I got less than half of it down. If I HAD to say one positive thing about this visit, it would be that the roughly 9 steak fries I was given, were hot, fresh and delicious. No, I didn't order a refill on them. No, the server never did come back after delivering our nasty food to ask how it was. Or why no one was eating.  Yes, after giving up on my burger, I don't know why, but I did ask for a To Go box. Which never came. In hindsight, that's perfectly fine with me.  Since no one really ate much dinner, someone made the questionable decision to order dessert to go, and I headed off to the restroom. I thought the night could not get worse, but I was wrong. I will spare you the details, but let's just say that they were dirty and I overheard some stuff in there that you never want to hear anywhere, let alone in a restaurant.  By the time I got back to the table, I was pretty sure I was done eating for the night.  Unfortunately, it took about 20 minutes for us to get our To Go desserts (they came out one at a time?) and our check came 5 minutes or so after that. We paid, left an 18% tip (not really sure why), and FINALLY we were free. But it wasn't over! When we got home, my party decided we should eat that dessert. (Ugh. Seriously, people?) My appetite was still shot, but in a feeble attempt to be a good sport, I forced down a couple sips of a chocolate milkshake, and a bite each of the red velvet cake and cheesecake. The milkshake was super rich, but tasted pretty good.  The red velvet cake was mushy and warm. (Why?) The cheesecake was inedible - warm and almost soupy. Our car ride was less than 15 minutes, and we had the air conditioner blasting, so I think it arrived at our table that way. It's like it had been sitting out all day.  This was the worst dining out experience I've had in at least 15 years. Or maybe ever. Never again.

Red Robin offers great burgers, fries and service.  Usually busy, make sure you avoid the obvious times if you are out with kids.   The service is always friendly; I've never had a problem there.  The décor is the same as always at all RRs for the last 20 years. Oriented towards kids but with great food, this copy of Red Robin has its act down.  It is efficient and has the recipes down pat.  The burgers are done to order and all the times I've asked for customizations I've never been turned down - so get what you want.  They're careful not to over-cook the burgers so don't over-compensate in your order.  Order whatever you want as your own creation or order one of their set burgers.  My very favorite is their teriyaki burger (strange that the only decent teriyaki sauce on the east coast is here - goes back to their west coast heritage).  It's easy to eat healthier here with their lighter options.  Their steak fries are just about as good as it gets - ask for some dips and try their house seasoning salt.  Two minor points of concern:  first - you can ask for garlic fries, but it seems spotty as far as when they're done well or not - I've had them pretty greasy before at this location so be prepared for that.

We usually go to the Red Robin at Fair Lakes but recently we have been going to this location. Before they changed their birthday club, I received my last free birthday burger, so we headed over to redeem it. I ordered what I usually order, a bowl of chili and the 'shroom burger and everything was perfect, as usual.  Never had a bad meal here. I usually fill myself up on free fry fills so I do not have room for the apple crisp, which I really should save room for since it is so good. We'll see how the new eclub thing works out.

Expect a long wait and unresponsive service, especially if you have kids.  They want big fat boozers here not kids and appear to seat parties with kids last.   Entered the restaurant at 12:35 on Monday 11/21/2011.  No estimate of wait was given by the hostess. Seated at 12:55.  No greeting at table while we watched who we believe to be our waiter (big fat guy with earings) casually talk to other tables right next to us.  No greeting, no water, no I'll be with you shortly.  We had a 2 and 4 year old with us.  We left at 1:10PM without eating.  Management was unresponsive.  When we explained why we were leaving, there was no apology or offer to correct....just a blank stare.     I just found out that our neighbors told us they got very sick at this restaurant after eating a chicken dish.   In addition to the waiter with tatoos - who didn't look clean, there were lots of unhealthing looking folks - very overweight.   There is a five guys burgers joint in the strip mall near this place and has great burgers and great service.  Cheaper, faster, and better ambiance.

Some of the best Artic Cod I've eaten in any restaurant. Ok, so it's frozen, who cares. They deep fry it just right and it is served just prefect. I'll cook my hamburgers at home and leave the Cod to Red Robin. It's the only entree I ever buy here. Sometimes I'll go for a bowl of French Onion Soup and a Root Beer float, that's also a great meal.  Never ever been disappointed here.....all stars.

Same food as every Red Robin everywhere. Worst service I've ever had. Half empty restaurant on a Sunday afternoon, yet we waited 25 min for a table and then I had to flag down a server. This place needs new management and servers who are willing to work. Skip this place.

Generally being a vegetarian I face the problem of getting a good veggie burger at most of the places I go to. Thankfully this place is flexible to substitute any burger with the veggie patty and makes it taste awfully good too. We had the BBQ Burger with Veggie Patty and it was amazing. The Fries and Coleslaw sides were fresh and good too. Loved It!

Been to Red Robin many times.  They have wonderful selections for burgers.  I like their Burnin' Love Burger.  I ordered Medium well today, but got the raw side.  :(  They have bottomless steak fries with burgers.  Tasted pretty good when they remember to season it.  I like that you can ask to replace the bun with whole grain bun. They have under 10 calories ice tea and lemonade which tasted pretty good.  I have tried Triple S Riblet Basket before and loved it. I have never tried it but they do offer Bottomless Root Beer Float. Parking could be a problem.

I'm not a huge fan of burgers and fries, but I had an awesome burger at Red Robin tonight.  I took the boyfriend out to celebrate the job offer I received (and accepted) today! We got onion rings (which are always awesome) and he ordered the burger with jalapenos and salsa (called the Burning Love Burger maybe?) and he said it was fantastic.  I got the Blue Ribbon Burger and it was fantastic.  It's got onion straws, steak sauce, chipotle mayo, lettuce/tomato, and bleu cheese... really great.  The bun has some herbs or something in it too... not sure what that was all about but it was a welcome alternative to your typical bun. The fries are great as usual, and their ranch is the best ranch out there - really garlicky and almost spicy - love it... brought some home! Last time I went, I got the fajitas - I was just not in a burger kinda mood.  The fajitas were AMAZING.  I didn't expect much, because come on, if you're looking for Mexican food, you're going to go to a Mexican restaurant.  While $11.99 is a bit steep for the portion size, they were delicious - perfectly cooked, with all the right sides and toppings. As for the service at the Chantilly location, it's always been great and tonight was no exception.  Our waitress kept the drinks coming (he and I suck them down like nobody's business) and was quick with our food and brought plenty of extra ranch and dipping sauces just like we asked.  I'd go back... but it wouldn't be my first choice, just not my favorite food... but great nonetheless!

I consider myself a Red Robin connoisseur.  There are likely not very many that take such pride in Red Robin, but I am not ashamed.  I have now been to Red Robin 16 birthdays in a row, dating back to my 11th birthday.  It has been a streak that has taken on it's own personality, and one I don't plan on breaking.  Like an old man reminiscing about his first female conquest, I often reminisce about the first time I was introduced to the marriage of egg and burger.  The Royal Red Robin burger is still one of the finest burgers I've ever had the pleasure of enjoying.  And I am a lover of Ray's Hell Burgers, the consensus best burger of the moment.   Is it a chain?  Is it decorated like a Chuck E. Cheese on a sugar rush?  Is it full of screaming kids?  Is the flair overwhelming?  Are dinners frequently interrupted by servers singing the Red Robin happy birthday song 6 times an hour?  Is it atrociously unhealthy?  Are the arcade games dated (who plays Cruisin' USA anymore?!)?  Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes.  Does it diminish my love for Red Robin?  Of course not.  Not when their product is so immensely satisfying, tasty, and incredible.  A veritable delight for the tastebuds.  A near smorgasborg of flavors and styles available in burger form.  An experience not to be missed. It's smart to stick to the burgers at Red Robin.  I've made the mistake of trying the Carnitas burger, as well as the pot roast burger.  There is nothing inherently wrong with either, they both were quite tasty.  But then you are faced with the opportunity cost that you potentially could have enjoyed a Royal Red Robin burger.  It is a regret that has kept me up at night.  So, I make sure to stick with a winner.  Other highlights on the menu are the Whiskey River Burger and the A-1 Peppercorn burger, as well as the Monster Burger.  The Monster Burger is a 1600 calorie behemoth loaded with cheese and a strangely magically delicious relish that makes the whole dish.  The beef used at Red Robin is not exceptional, just good, but the various burger configurations on the menu are really what make them special.   The Royal Red Robin Burger is topped with a fried egg, mayo, lettuce, tomato, cheese.  It is a real slice of heaven.  I can't recommend it enough.  I have enjoyed a Gus Burger at the White Spot in Charlottesville, what many proclaim to be the best egg-on-burger combo.  While delicious, it is perhaps 75% as tasty as the Royal Red Robin.   Red Robin also offers unlimited steak fries with all burgers/sandwiches.  I am a huge fan of steak fries, and Red Robin really hits a home run with theirs.  Perfectly cooked so it has a little bit of firmness and crisp, but doesn't overshadow the meaty nature of steak fries.  Paired with the secret blend of herbs and spices in the Red Robin seasoning provided at every table, the fries really come alive with flavor.  To top it off, there is no reason to order one of the adequate appetizers (although the towering onion rings are a spectacle to be seen) because you can request a basket of fries for free from your waitstaff.   Understanding that the target market for Red Robin is children between 6-15, I am not embarassed to say that it is my inner circle of favorite restaurants.  When my birthday comes around again, I will not be embarassed to drag my fiance and make my streak 17 years in a row(although she should be pleased I'm not choosing fancy/expensive).  I highly recommend Red Robin for all events, ranging from birthdays, children's birthdays, anniversaries, even engagements.  After all, there is no better way to say "I want to spend my entire life with you" then a Royal Red Robin Burger and gift of jewelery won in the crane machine located in the restaurant entryway.

Food was okay. Service was horrible. Waiter was very overwhelmed with three tables. Manager was sitting on a table with other waitresses all on their cell phone while I waited 10 min to get my bill. Second time with a bad experience--won't be going back again.
Great food! Even better happy hour!! draft beers starting at 2.50, margaritas at 3.50, and well liquor at 3.5 I think too!

What can I say?  It's a chain, so you're going to be served by high schoolers.  The food is decent, though it lacks anything special.  All around, though, it's a great burger chain and I love the unlimited fries.

I have to admit to being a fan of Red Robin for several reasons.  First, as a mother of two young girls, it's a great family establishment - and who doesn't love balloons?  Second, I'm a HUGE fan of their turkey burger.  Let me reiterate...the turkey burger is AWESOME.  It's not your typical dry, flavorless turkey burger.  This one has great texture, it's uber-moist, and best of all, it's served with a delicious chipotle-mayonnaise that's great on their bottomless fries, too.  I order the turkey burger every time I go, purely for taste, not health reasons. We visitied this particular location last week when we were in the area (we're buying a home in Aldie...yay!...so we were there for a home inspection) and needed a lunch place for our kids to enjoy.   The service was friendly (if a tad slow at times, but to be fair our server was busy) and the place was clean.  My daughter's balloon blew away in the parking lot and they were more than cheerful to replace it. We'll definitely be back.
Yum, Yum this place has delicious burgers.  Fries are good too, but I like that you can get a side of steamed veggies in place of them to be a little healthier!

We hiked Old Rag last Saturday and subsisted the entire time on granola bars.  So, needless to say we were near starvation by the time we got back to civilization.  What was the biggest, greasiest, bad for you food we could think of during the drive down 66?  My old friend, Red Robin.  Only clucks and fries would help me recover from that grueling hike.  I was a bit concerned about arriving there around 6 PM because usually RR is crawling with families and has a huge wait by that time (at least back home it does).  But this place was abandoned, it was great.  Our food was ready super fast and I was able to go into a food coma for the final part of the drive home. This is in a little shopping complex with a Target and a few other stores so you can be lazy like me and run all your errands at once.  Oh, and I'm pretty sure the entire restaurant is non-smoking.

Its really more like 3.5 stars I think the moral of the story with Red Robin is stick to the burgers.  I went here once and they had a burger salad (seriously a hamburger on a salad!) but they dont have that anymore.  I opted for the Lettuce wrapped protein burger, which is basically a leftover from the bunless Atkin's phase.  But it was actually pretty good!  I really liked the fact it came with a mini salad, plus i was dying for a hamburger but didn't want to go completely overboard. It was definitely a good compromise of health and indulgence.   And in all honesty, i think the burger is far superior to five guys.  Its not overly greasy, but has that perfectly cooked juiciness to it.   I was definitely glad we went here! My friend got some kind of apple/chicken/nut salad.   It was kind of expensive (like 11 bucks) and while they said it tasted good, i had to hear about how hungry they were the rest of the evening.  Obviously not filling whatsoever.    Some of their appetizers (like the tower of onion rings, and cheeseburger queso) sounded really good and would definitely be something to try if one didn't care about their waistline.  All of their burgers come with never ending fries, but i highly reccommend upgrading to the garlic fries.  They are tasty! Stick tot eh burgers and fries.  Thats what they do best around here!

I've been to the Ashburn VA location so I decided to meet some friends at the Chantilly location.  The first time we went, it wasn't that busy but the service was very slow.  The 2nd and last time we went we were told there was over an hour wait...and honestly...their food is DEFINITELY NOT worth waiting for an hour.  We walked to the Famous Daves who shares the same parking lot and waited to sit down for our meal.  Food in general was good.  I wouldnt make a special trip to eat there.

First off the things I liked: The Whiskey Burger was good, but it left something to the imagination. The A-1 Peppercorn Burger was divine, the garlic parm steak fries hit the spot. Things I didn't like: The mixed drinks were weak. My waiter screwed up my order terribly yesterday (we went twice, this happened to be my second time back) so he wasn't left a tip. Other than that I will most likely go back most def in a different locale.

When you go to Red Robin, you expect certain things: 1. Everything will be too salty. This is fast food, people. Get over it. 2. Something in your order is likely to be wrong, but it'll be fixed rapidly. 3. Your kids will be distracted by all the TV's in the place. If you accept these facts, you'll have a filling meal and some laffs with the kids (who will gorge themselves on the mac-n-cheese). If you do NOT accept these facts, STAY AWAY. As it is, with kids in tow it's nice to have the consistency that the Robin offers.

This place had great chicken sandwiches and all you can eat fries.  The service is not bad, but sometimes you have to wait awhile for lunch.  Parking is sometimes a pain in the butt, but overall this place isnt bad.  The burgers are really good too.
Great for the kids!  i like the so many choices in burgers and their shakes are so so so good!  Fi a shake is not your thing then get a Freckled Lemonade, delicious!!!

My second time there with a couple of people.  First visit was a weekend and the service was fast and we saw lots of our waitress.  Yesterday on a Weds around 3, the service was fair but we did spend time wondering when we would next see our waitress.  Both time I ordered the Royal Red Robin which comes with an egg and bacon.  It is a pretty yummy burger.  And both times my cohorts were happy and polished off their burgers. Endless steak fries are OK but nothing better than you could make at home use Ore-Ida.  Now you got to watch it on the beverages.  Having non alcoholic special lemonades and ice tea, the beverages were over half the total cost of a 40 dollar bill yesterday, 22 dollars in non alcoholic drinks for 3 people and 18 bucks on hamburgers.  I asked for a takeaway cup rather than leave 4 bucks of a drink behind.  So watch it on the beverages, with tip and tax we paid almost 50 bucks for 3 people to eat burgers. Since the DMV is becoming a great burger town with more choices i have had better for cheaper.

I had my good-bye lunch there with about 12 co-workers and impressively, we were all seated immediately after showing up at 1130 without a reservation.  Service was pretty incredible with the waitress asking us what we wanted to drink even when the entire party hasn't shown up yet.  She came by every 5 minutes or so asking when we want to start ordering.  Our orders came within 10 minutes and she asked if our fries and drinks needed refilling so often I lost track.  The fries were unbelievably fresh hot and good.  Plus the endless fries basket made the trip even sweeter.  However, I should have stuck to my gut and ordered a burger.  When you're in a burger joint, don't order anything but a burger.  I had the Salmon Red Robin Rice Bowl and it was totally forgettable.  Imagine three pieces of overcooked nuggets of salmon filet on a bed of frozen and flavorless veggies on top of a huge pile of rice.  Sadly, the sesame sauce was the best part of the entire meal.  If I got burgers I'd rate this a 5, but the rice dish that was a 1.  So, stick with burgers and the fries and you've got a pretty good experience.

We like RR for a burger or other things.  It is fairly quick to get in and out, but not great for a "real" sit-down dinner.  As others have said, there tend to be a lot of kids and it can be very loud.  One time we had to get up and go out to the patio because of a girls soccer team party inside, with screeching and yelling.  Even my teen girls couldn't stand it! Aside from that, the service is always good.  We like the burgers OK, but my wife goes for the BLTA (Bacon Lettuce Tomato & Avacodo) Sandwich and I like their wraps.  We both like the Fish & Chips, altho sometimes they are a bit greasy.  The fries are delicious and unlimited.   We definitely recommend it if you know what to expect.

Usually I don't write reviews, but this was well worth it. We had a surprise birthday party for 20 on a friday evening and the whole thing went off superbly well thanks to the wonderful staff. Our server, Andrew, was impeccable and provided prompt and courteous service the entire evening, making sure that everything was taken cared for. The only downside was that I had to arrive 30 minutes earlier to hold a table for a large group, since they don't take reservations. But all in all, I appreciate the work they took to make sure that the event went off with a hitch. I highly recommend this place for parties/gatherings. You may not get your own private room, but the good menu prices and prompt service will make it well worth it. Thanks again, Red Robin Chantilly!
Very yummy. Will come here again. Pretty fast service and loved the bottomless drinks and fries.

I haven't been to a Red Robin in years so for nostalgia's sake I met my cousin there for lunch.  Their steak fries haven't changed at all and are just as yummy as ever.  My burger however was a bit on the salty side and the melted cheddar tasted a little plasticky.  My cousin had the mushroom burger and swears by it, I should have split it with her...

Red Robin doesn't want to admit that they are the wanna be designer teenage version of a hamburger centric Shoney's.  But they are. Yes , the meal was hot and good and service was friendly and fast. When my waiter asked if I liked my meat pink or brown, I knew what to expect.  It was reasonably priced (disclaimer: robbin'  is in the name of the store) for a sit down restaurant and I came home with a balloon. The kind they use to smash the heart attack causing plaque before they insert the stent in your artery. But you know what made my "gourmet burger" experience even better? A costumed Woody Wood Pecker, the restaurant's lovable if copyright infringed mascot, giving me high 5's and hand shakes during my meal. Its like freaking Disney in there! Seriously tweens my waiter was right out of High School Musical.

Good food, but way too loud.  I must be getting old.  Been here probably 30 times in the last 2 years.  Lots of choices for burgers and fixin's.  Atmosphere is lively.  The music is blaring and the restaurant is usually full of business folks at lunchtime.  Not a lot of kids at lunchtime (except in summer) although this is a kid-friendly place.  As far as my experience yesterday, I couldn't hear anything my lunch partner was saying which is the usual in this location.  To add to the noise level, one of the waiters played the drums with his hands on the counter behind us.  And didn't have a very good rhythm which is why we noticed.  Did enjoy the garlic parm fries.  The chili burger was ok and could have been warmer.  I usually get a cheeseburger and onion rings which are awesome.  The paper around the burger keeps everything together.  Wish the burgers were hot with cold fixin's...the room temp burger doesn't do much for me and sometimes the burgers (the meat) have actually been on the verge of being cold.  The onion rings are usually hot and crispy though.  The queso dip was kind of like melted plastic and not very tasty.  And our service was pretty slow, but our waiter was also serving three large parties so we cut him some slack.  The menu here is different than the Fair Lakes location a few miles away.  Odd.  Really like the food but don't enjoy having to yell to have a conversation.

OK four stars for the cheeseburger and fries.   I have no idea what the rest of the menu is like (and it looks like your typical chain restaurant menu - aka not great), as I'm a creature of habit and when I find something I like, I order the same meal each time I visit.  Or rather, when I want a good cheeseburger and fries, I go to Red Robin. It is "not" a place with great adult ambiance (my husband and I are childless by choice) and this place is full of kids (aka - loud) but heck, it is a burger place, and that's what we go for.  We do tend to visit before and after "kid rush hour" so that it is quieter.   Red Robin has the level of service you'd expect at a chain restaurant (i.e. waitstaff are young and probably this is their first ever job), but again, we knew it was a chain restaurant going in. But I LOVE the fat steak fries... and the cheeseburger is nearly always scrumptious.  (once it was overcooked, but as we'd had 99% good experiences up till then, we gave them another chance, and it has been good since then.) The only other place we go for burgers is Five Guys (closer), and they have good fries too (though different - fried in peanut oil) but Red Robin tops Five Guys for burgers in our opinion (not as greasy and more flavorful.)

As a follow-up to my prior review.  I provided feedback to Red Robin through their customer feedback survey.  I was pleasantly surprised by the immediate response that I received from Red Robin.  Both the Restaurant Manager and the Regional Manager  reached out to me with their apologies. What I was grateful for the most, was the effort and time they spent wanting to learn more about my experience.  They're response assures me that the experience that I had was an anomaly and not indicative of the typical experience at Red Robin.  I appreciate their time and look forward to meeting with them in person during my next visit.

This tends to be the place my group of friends ends up going whenever there's a lot of us - it's the only thing we can all agree on. Luckily, I think Red Robin is one of the best chain sit-down restaurants there is, and I'm rarely not in the mood to go there. They have a pretty big menu, but I haven't been impressed by much on it besides the burgers. But if you stick with those, you're golden, and there's enough variety that you'll probably find a couple things you really like. I've probably eaten around 25 Whiskey River BBQ burgers in my life, and I still haven't gotten sick of them.  The best part, though, is the limitless fries that come with every burger, probably the biggest reason I keep going back. Though the quality is not always consistent, most days I'd be willing to call them the best fries you can get in Fairfax. Especially with ranch on the side. I also love that I can get any burger with a Boca patty. A lot of American chain restaurants have limited vegetarian options, so this place is sort of a vegetarian boon amid the chain restaurants of suburbia.

When I crave a burger, Red Robin is one of my two my favorites.  The staff does a super job keeping the restaurant clean and are always cheerful.  I have never waited to be seated.  The burgers are up there with the best I've ever had.  I love their bottomless fries policy!  But my hips don't :(

The burgers here are delicious and the fries are bottomless, which means that they are constantly refilled.  This is very good place to eat for any occasion and the food is always hot and delicious.  The service is also outstanding and everything on the menu so far seems very good.
i asked for med well i got rare...my coke was diet without any ice with no straw....need i say more? lol
